nodes.bodyText: need to return 2 paths here (the old and the new), so this is List
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -87,16 +87,22 @@ public FileDeps(InternalProjectConfiguration config) { /** * Returns the path to the Java SDK static libraries for this configuration. The path is cached on the provided * configuration. If no custom directory has been set in the project configuration and useGraalPath - * is set to true, it will use the lib directory inside the configured Graal path. If - * useGraalPath is set to false, a custom Java SDK will be retrieved. + * is set to true, it will use the lib/static/$target-$arch/ directory inside the + * configured Graal path. If useGraalPath is set to false, a custom Java SDK will + * be downloaded. * * @param useGraalPath specifies if the default Java SDK path should resolve to the Graal installation dir * @return the location of the static libraries of the Java SDK for the arch-os for this configuration * @throws IOException in case anything goes wrong. */ public Path getJavaSDKLibsPath(boolean useGraalPath) throws IOException {

nodes.bodyText: Wouldn't it be better to just check for the existence of the "lib/static" directory? If it does, return that, otherwise return the old path?

nodes.bodyText: For now I'm ok with that, but in general (different issue), I feel we have to add more safety to the paths we link from (more paths in a specific order, without specifying logic)
